reviews.text: I was in New Orleans for a business trip a few months ago, I ate breakfast at Oceana and tried their char-broiled oysters.... I have never been so sick in my life. A hospital visit and a week later I finally recovered. Needless to say after watching the new Kitchen Nightmares episode, now I know why! How terrifying!!!
Ordered the pasta jambalaya for delivery on eat 24. Food was subpar at best and the portion size was ridiculously small I could've been a side dish and I was charged $20 for it.

Not only do you expect high quality bc you're in New Orleans but also because anyone can make fried food taste good. Right?! Apparently not this place. It wasn't exactly bad so much as "Applebees" quality. The staff was super nice but it's unfortunate that this place is representative of local NOLA.

I've been lots of times over the years. The first few years of going it was amazing, but the last two times I've gone it was totally different and terrible. I asked for ramolaud sauce on the side of my poboy and dressed. When it arrived it came with nothing on it but 8 pieces of fried shrimp on the whole thing

We took a bunch of our college students to experience the food and culture of NO and this is the first place we took them to eat. It was just OK. They ambiance was just so so and the food was just ok. The food was not well presented and the food just was not what we expected for the price we paid.  The waiter was really trying very hard to make us feel welcomed. We were not impressed. I think we got the nice server that everyone else got.

This was the only place open late on Tuesday night when we were visiting New Orleans. It wasn't very good, but the food wasn't awful either. The food is also not very fresh. It tastes frozen. I thought this place was a chain restaurant like Chili's. I asked the waiter and he said this is the one and only.

I can't remember exactly what drink we got, but it was very watered down. There was basically no alcohol in it. The barbecue shrimp was pretty good. It reminded me of an Asian dish my mom makes all the time. The shrimp was huge too. I had a Cajun Jambalaya pasta. It was very good, but I feel like there was a lot of dairy product mixed in. The alligator sausage was my favorite part. :)  My brother-in-law had the redfish. It was tasty, but rubbery. I assume it is because it might have been frozen. 

The service was great. Our waiter was very funny and helpful. The outdoor seating was beautiful. I wish we were sat out there. Overall, if you are up for a late night dinner and every where else is closed or has no more room.
Ok. The 'Taste of New Orleans' meal was served cold. Had to send back to have reheated. Overrated restaurant in my opinion.

Was a little disappointed in the food.  Got the sampler thing and didn't love the meal.   Prices were pretty good compared to other places that offered the same thing.  My wife liked the clams but I didn't care for them much.  The line outside was about 20 deep when we got there but only took about 10 mins to get a table.  Considering how crowded the place was at about 7:00 on a Tuesday night, other people are really
enjoying the food.   But didn't really hit the spot with me.

I stopped into Oceana for a late night bite to eat. I ordered a shrimp po boy and fries. The food came out relatively quickly and service was okay. The food itself was pretty average. I have had better sandwiches in less expensive places. People always say you have to go to Oceana if you come to New Orleans, I say you can save your money and go some place else and still get an authentic New Orleans seafood experience.

Pasta looked and smelled amazing. I ordered a meal with no onions ( I'm allergic). And they definitely put tiny onions in the dish. The server was very polite and he replaced my order within 5-10 minutes. I would give them a higher rating but an allergy mistake can be life threatening.

Finally, a meal in the Big Easy worth writing about.  After fair to middling meals, we decided to try Oceana.  Normally wonder about places when the Hop on/off trolleys forced discount coupons on us, but Oceana was definitely a surprise, nice atmospheric brick walls and pillars, friendly staff and great food.
Carol ordered the Alligator bites appetizer...which had a great breading and spicy dipping sauce, but it was still alligator. 
I ordered a Tidal Wave "Juggles Favorite. "  Which is 1800 Silver, Midori and Tropical juices.  Excellent!
Carol ordered Jambalaya on pasta which was very good.  I had Crab cakes with a crawdads gravy and mashed potatoes and collard green, which I enjoyed.
Dian, however had the Oceania Red Fish with fried crawdads.  The fish was over cooked and had a part so dry she couldn't even eat it.  She said it was bland and under seasoned.  
They offered her another puece, but by then she was done with it.  They didn't offer any price reduction or dessert.
So three out five...just ovoid the red fish.

We visited this restaurant last night for a few reasons... 1) It was a Christmas, and most restaurants were closed, 2) It was open until 1AM, and we had just gotten into NOLA on a late flight, 3)  It was rated number one on Yelp. We were a little nervous considering this restaurant was featured on Kitchen Nightmares, but decided enough time had passed and improvements were probably made. Was it horrible? No. Was it the best? I wouldn't say that either. We ordered a shrimp po boy and oyster platter. The number one mistake I would say is that the food didn't come out hot... it was warmishly cold. The seafood tasted like it may have been frozen. The bread on my po boy was soft and didn't have much of a crunch (a little toasting could have helped). Service was prompt though, and the waiter was nice. Overall, not a place I'd go out of my way to return to, but if nothing else was open then sure I'd return. (Tip: Acme Oyster House is my favorite seafood restaurant... not just in NOLA, but possibly even in the world)

Got a recommendation from my hotel on char grilled oysters and Oceana didn't fail to deliver. A few blocks up the street from my hotel and off Bourbon Street this some what obscure place comes across as your typical tourist location with a sign out from "Line Starts Here", fortunately I was somewhat early so I missed the dinner crowd. I sat at the bar and it was pretty full all over, and I took the menu and went for Oceana's famous Char-grilled Oysters. I ordered a dozen and what I got was incredible, there were 12 nice plump oysters that had been char-grilled with a unique zesty garlic and cream herb Cajun sauce, finished with a fresh blend of Parmesan and Romano cheeses. It was plenty food for me and I was completely satisfied.
The food was average and the server was constantly trying to upsell in a sleazy way. The po-boy was entirely bread with a tiny amount of fish. I would go somewhere else unless you're starving.

Hi, the food was good only the portions were small. I was surprised because up until today every was large enough to share except here . The potatoes were good but barely half a cup as well was the vegetables . I said to the waiter oh you forgot the potatoes. He said they are in the same little bowl as the vegetables. The desserts were very small and I will not be returning to the Oceania . There are too many other good choices.
This is my second time visiting Oceana Grill.  This time around I had the bayou blacken duck and it was great.....large portions so make sure you have an appetite (you'll need it).
This was SO GOOD!! The line to get in moves fast, the service was quick and the food was delish.

Line with around 15 people ahead of us out the door. We were seated in only 10 minutes. Everyone here is so incredibly polite. Shout out to Desiree! Classic New Orleans dishes. The crawfish etouffe and red beans and rice were top quality. Crab cakes were excellent. Only caveat was the bread, while good, was not amazing like magic bread (see YATS (Indianapolis) review) Our bell hop at the hotel suggested this place for dinner and we were definitely not disappointed!
Came here for the grilled oysters! It was ok. Not sure I like them smothered in garlic remoulade!  The service was superb.

Most people say when you see a long line in front of any restaurant in NOLA that means the food is so good ! Very true lol ! 

My cousin and some friends told me to try Oceana when ever I go to NOLA! I did and was happy ! 

It looks like a little Resturant from the outside but it's really big inside . It has different levels and various seating area .   Nothing too fancy but very yummy and tasty food ! 

I went on a Sunday afternoon around 2pm and there was no line at all . We were seated right away on the ground level in the seating area close to the kitchen toward the back . Food came fast ! Nice size ! Customer service was great !
Everything was really good.  I had the blackened redfish and oyster Rockefeller.  It was delicious.  I would definitely recommend this place.

Are you gluten-free? They have a vegetarian and gluten- free menu here. I had the redfish with potatoes and greens. Delicious! Atmosphere, knowledge and friendliness of waitstaff are sure to sway your decision in favor of Oceana. I'll come back.

Oceana Grill is right off Bourbon Street, has a neat small courtyard, and pretty good food. It's definitely worth a stop by. I had the catfish po boy and I was very impressed. I'm not a huge catfish fan but this was milder than usual and pretty big. The remoulade had the right amount of heat and the fries were standard. The crab cake burger is pretty spicy but the red beans and rice are excellent. 
We were there Mardi Gras week and it wasn't a crazy long wait for lunch. Our waiter was great and engaged us in conversation which was nice. Beware of birds in the courtyard, just FYI.
Had the jambalaya pasta. It was so amazing I was licking the plate! My friend had the crab cake pasta and she said "yeah whatever it was good". I will be back for more!

Visiting New Orleans 
I was referred to, " Oceana's" in the French Quarter.
Long line out the door waiting to be seated but went in and ask about sitting at the bar - which you can eat at the bar - no wait!
"Josh," bartender - awesome bartender and good has a good sense of humor.
Ordered a nice beer and then a crab cake - which was awesome !
Then ordered 
Louisiana blackened redfish fillet a top crawfish cornbread topped with our  creamy shrimp pontchartrain  sauce and served with a side of mustard greens 
What a dish !!!!

Great place for lunch, we were a little hesitant to go at first but I'm glad we did.

Lunch was phenomenal and we were stuffed afterwards. I have a group had to take naps at the hotel afterwards before we could go out again. Service is a little slow but definitely worth it.
I ate here 4 times while on vacation   Food is delicious and service was great.  Catfish, sandwiches and pastas were yummy.   Dessert was delicious also    Definitely will return
Great food at reasonable prices.  Always visit this restaurant when we are visiting New Orleans.  The jambalaya and gumbo is delicious.

Food: The food was incredible. The absolute best item was the bread pudding. I'll definitely keep going back to get it. It was sensational. The oysters with the sauce were incredible. I didn't love the beans from the taste of New Orleans but the other two dishes were good. The crab cakes were very salty but the rice was amazing. The gator bites were also really good.

Vibe: The vibe of the venue and the staff was absolutely incredible. They were super fast and friendly and helpful. I forgot my phone and the waiter chased me in the street to hand it back. Absolutely wonderful and would definitely keep going back.

Ugh so good 
Got the Cajun fries, gumbo, and taste of New Orleans
All so good had a lot of leftovers lol because I wanted to try it all
Our server Ron was so great and kind!
